definitions.definition: A difficulty that has to be resolved or dealt with.
examples: She's leaving because she faced numerous problems to do with racism.

subdefinitions.definition: An addiction , other substance use disorder, or comparable psychological challenge.
examples: I think he has a gambling problem . Lending him money will probably only make it worse.
I think he has a nose candy problem . Lending him money will probably only make it worse.

definitions.definition: A question to be answered, schoolwork exercise .
examples: Study hard, but don't overdo it. The problems in the exam won't be difficult to solve.
You got a problem with that?

definitions.definition: Difficulty in accepting or understanding or refusal to accept or understand.
examples: You made your best honest effort; if they judge you harshly, that’s their problem , not yours.

definitions.definition: A set of moves required to complete a climb .

main_definition: A difficulty that has to be resolved or dealt with.
secondary_definitions: A question to be answered, schoolwork exercise .
Difficulty in accepting or understanding or refusal to accept or understand.
( climbing ) A set of moves required to complete a climb .
